page.title: 10CANOEING AND LOCAL RIVERS
page.content: Both the Ettrick and Tweed are used by local clubs for canoeing. The Ettrick can be run from Ettrickbridge until it meets the Tweed. In winter the river levels never fall below the 10cm required to float a modern canoe. The Tweed can usually be paddled summer and winter and is widely used for its pleasant scenery and its more exciting passages at Yair cauld and Yair bridge. Canoeists from Edinburgh and the Lothians make extensive use of the river which can be run from Walkerburn to the sea at Berwick. The rivers rarely freeze over, when they do there are always large stretches unfrozen even in the hardest of the local frosts.
